snippet: The Bank of Japan’s efforts to reinvigorate the nation’s economy are showing results, at least in the sinking value of the yen.
abstract: Japanese yen falls to 100 per US dollar, having declined fully 14 percent so far in 2013; is sign that pro-inflation policies of Prime Min Shinzo Abe and Bank of Japan are helping lift Japan's 's economy; weaker yen makes Japanese exports more competitive on global stage.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and GRAHAM BOWLEY
byline.contributor: Hiroko Tabuchi reported from Tokyo and Graham Bowley from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Bank of Japan’s efforts to reinvigorate the nation’s economy are showing results, at least in the sinking value of the yen.

headline.main: Pro-Inflation Policies Show Signs of Helping the Japanese Economy
headline.print_headline: Pro-Inflation Policies Show Signs of Helping the Japanese Economy
